description.p: Rangers who walk the Path of the Whistling Death master a rare and feared art: commanding a magical arrow with the sound of their whistle. Their Whistler Arrow weaves through the battlefield, an unstoppable storm of death. Few survive once the arrow begins its terrible song.

p.em: 3rd-level Path of the Whistling Death feature

description.p: You forge a magical bond with a unique arrow called the Whistler Arrow. As a bonus action, you can command the Whistler Arrow to fly toward a creature you can see within 60 feet and make a ranged spell attack.
You use your Wisdom modifier for the attack and damage rolls. On a hit, the Whistler Arrow deals 2d6 piercing damage.

This damage increases as you gain ranger levels: 3d6 at 7th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 6d6 at 15th level. Starting at 15th level, the Whistler Arrow also deals an additional 1d8 force damage on each hit.
The Whistler Arrow ignores half and three-quarters cover and curves around obstacles. It automatically returns to you after the attack.

sheet.description: Bonus Action: Command your Whistler Arrow to attack. (2d6 → 6d6 scaling piercing damage). At 15th level, add +1d8 force damage. Ignores cover and curves around obstacles.

p.em: 3rd-level Path of the Whistling Death feature

description.p: Your mastery of the Whistler Arrow allows you to target multiple foes. When you hit a creature with your Whistler Arrow, you can immediately target a second creature within 10 feet of the original target, making a separate attack roll against it.
At 11th level, the distance increases to 20 feet. At 15th level, it increases to 30 feet, and you can chain up to three additional creatures total.

sheet.description: Whistler Arrow pierces secondary targets within 10 → 30 feet, chaining more attacks as you level up.

p.em: 7th-level Path of the Whistling Death feature

description.p: You can unleash a storm of attacks. As an action, you command the Whistler Arrow to attack a number of creatures you can see within 60 feet, up to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1 target).
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.
At 15th level, you can use Storm Call as a bonus action instead of an action.

sheet.description: Action: Whistler Arrow attacks up to Wisdom modifier targets. Bonus Action use at 15th level.

p.em: 11th-level Path of the Whistling Death feature

description.p: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with the Whistler Arrow, you can immediately redirect it to attack another creature within 30 feet of the last target. You can chain these redirections a number of times up to your Wisdom modifier per turn.
Each chained attack deals an additional 1d8 force damage, stacking with each new target hit.

sheet.description: Chain Whistler Arrow attacks on kill (up to Wisdom modifier times). Each chained hit deals +1d8 extra force damage stacking.

p.em: 15th-level Path of the Whistling Death feature

description.p: Your Whistler Arrow becomes an unstoppable whirlwind. When you use Storm Call or Song of the Slayer, each creature damaged must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be knocked prone and disarmed (dropping one held item of your choice).
In addition, whenever a creature is hit by your Whistler Arrow, it cannot take reactions until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: Whirlwind: Save or prone + disarm on Storm Call and Song of the Slayer. All Whistler Arrow hits suppress reactions until your next turn.
